results.title: A Woman's story
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions, Humphrey Swingler and Joe Mendoza
results.brief_description: Through the story of one woman, the film gives an account of the work done by thousands of women in Britain who devote part of their spare time to various voluntary social services. The film is also significant in its exploration of the precursor of what would become the Department of Family and Community Services, staffed not by philanthropic local volunteers but by professional social workers.

results.title: A Woman's place is...
results.creator_credit: Elspeth MacDougall, Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
This film was made during the International Women’s Year, 1975 and focuses on Sweden as an example of committed government using the full range of tools at its disposal in a real attempt to give substance to equality for women as set down in the United Nations Charter. Discusses women’s role in the workforce, sexism in the advertising world, men’s role in parenting and sharing house duties, educating primary aged children about gender roles and stereotyping, and basically highlighting the need for equality in all areas of life. Narrated by Joyce Gordon.

results.title: A Woman's place is in the house
results.creator_credit: WGBH (Boston), Nancy W Porter and Mickey Lemle
results.brief_description: Made in 1976, this film is a profile of Elaine Noble, who was Massachusetts’ State Representative and who is a homosexual. Elaine Noble talks about her openness towards her homosexuality and she comments on the effects of this on her personal and professional life. She also discusses the variety of issues that she must deal with in her electoral district.

results.title: A Woman's place ... is on the school council
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Warren Thomas
results.brief_description: A program designed to encourage women to become members of their school council. Emphasises the need for effective communication and how to overcome barriers to communication.

results.title: A woman's place
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner, Chris McCullough, Australia-Japan Foundation and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into Japan”.
Examines how geishas are trained in song, dance, and sophisticated conversation, and how they still reign supreme as Japan’s most prestigious entertainers, as compared to women who work in clubs and bars. Geishas are employed for important functions. The program also takes a very general look at the state of women in Japan today.

results.title: A Woman's face
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Victor Saville and George Cukor
results.brief_description: In Stockholm, a trial for murder takes place - the accused is Anna Holm, a notorious woman believed to have murdered her former lover and partner in crime. The story which unfolds is intense, suspenseful and gripping. The climax is riveting. Joan Crawford will amaze you as Anna Holm, a multi-layered characterization posing intriguing emotional and psychological suggestions. The strange relationship between Anna and the sardonic Jorsten Barring is excitingly brought to dramatic life by Joan Crawford and Conrad Veidt. Melvyn Douglas plays Dr. Segert, the plastic surgeon who turns the scarred Anna Holm into a beautiful woman without erasing the scars of her soul. From the play “Il etait une fois” by Francis De Croisset.

results.title: A Winter Tan
results.creator_credit: Canada Council, Ontario Arts Council, Ontario Film Development Corporation, Telefilm Canada, Louise Clark, Jackie Burroughs, John Walker and John Frizzell
results.brief_description: ‘A winter tan’ is based on the book “Give Sorrow Words: Maryse Holder’s Letters From Mexico”, published in 1979 after Holder’s disappearance and presumed death. The result is a film of astonishing direct frankness, which reveals a woman on a quest for love, sex and freedom but determined to tell all to us as an audience. She is prepared to reveal her humiliations as well as her highs. She drinks. She dances. She goes through intense periods of promiscuity and self-examination, telling us every detail of her triumphs and disappointments with the men (and boys) of the bars, beaches and backstreets of Mexico. Cast includes Jackie Burroughs, Erando Gonzalez and Anita Olanick.

results.title: A Winter's tale = Conte d'hiver
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer, Margaret Menegoz and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Tales of the four seasons = Contes des quatre saisons”.
Felicie’s love for Charles is undiminished four years after a romantic idyll during a summer holiday in Brittany but he has not contacted her - the home address she gave him was incorrect. In the meantime she has given birth to his daughter and is unable to choose between two adoring suitors. Rohmer, with more than a passing reference to Shakespeare, locates his customarily precise observation of the everyday complexities of human psychology in a tale of accident and coincidence. For Felice, the emotional aftermath of a lost summer is suspended or frozen until the thaw of a spring of promise. In French with English subtitles. Cast includes Charlotte Very, Frederic Van Den Driessche and Michel Voletti.

results.title: A Window to trade
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Elisabeth Knight and Susan Cornwell
results.brief_description: Shows the role of the International Trade Development Centres in advising and guiding business about the marketing of overseas products to Australia. Seminars are regularly conducted in all cities. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: A Window on the world of classical ballet
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Rob McAuley and Don Featherstone
results.brief_description: Narrated by Richard Morecroft, this entertaining and informative video takes a look at the dailt routine of the Australian Ballet to obtain a better understanding and appreciation of classical ballet. Watch a daily ballet class, take a peek behind the scenes of staging a ballet, meet the dancers and watch a rehearsal and performance of the Act II Pas de deux from Swan Lake. Featured artists include Miranda Coney, Greg Horsman, Steven Heathcote, Campbell McKenzie and Justine Summers and the Australian Ballet School.
